description.narrative:
Denmark's humanitarian support is guided by the "Strategy for Danish Humanitarian Action 2010-2015", and its overall strategic priorities and in particular the objectives of 'protecting conflict-affected populations' with a focus on vulnerable groups, and 'strengthening partnerships'.
Denmark has identified UNFPA as a key implementing partner organization in the priority area of protection, and entered into a Humanitarian Partnership Agreement with UNFPA in 2011. Under the Agreement, Danish support is provided to UNFPA humanitarian programme interventions in countries experiencing protracted humanitarian crises.
In February 2014, Denmark agreed with UNFPA's two-year plan for 2014-2015 for humanitarian action under the Humanitarian Partnership Agreement. The 2-year plan focuses on "Innovations to Eliminate Gender-based Violence in Humanitarian Contexts".
In 2014, Denmark provided support under the Humanitarian Partnership Agreement for GBV programmes in Palestine, South Sudan, Sudan and Yemen as well as global support to operational programmes.

organisation.narrative: Humanitarian Action, Civil Society and Engagement
